description: Nakajima Youko is your average somewhat timid high school student. One day, a strange man named Keiki appears before her, swearing allegiance. Before she could properly register what was happening, demon-like creatures attack Youko and her friends, after which they are pulled into a different world. A world unlike what she has ever known. Separated from Keiki, Youko and her friends must do whatever they can if they wish to survive in this new world.
synonyms: 12 อาณาจักรเทพยุทธ์

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Language Barrier
tags.description: A barrier to communication between people who are unable to speak a common language.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Kingdom Management
tags.description: Characters in these series take on the responsibility of running a town or kingdom, whether they take control of an existing one, or build their own from the ground up.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Shrine Maiden
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a shrine maiden.

tags.name: Royal Affairs
tags.description: Features nobility, alliances, arranged marriage, succession disputes, religious orders and other elements of royal politics.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Chimera
tags.description: Features a beast made by combining animals, usually with humans.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

title.native: 東の海神 西の滄海
風の万里　黎明の空

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/芝美奈子)

Noted for her character designs on [Black Butler](https://anilist.co/anime/4898/), [Noir](https://anilist.co/anime/272/), [Tegami Bachi](https://anilist.co/anime/6444/) among many others.

[Profile (JVC)](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/-/Profile/A014076.html)

Mika Arisaka is a Japanese-American singer and vocalist.

[Website](http://ryokunihiko.com/)

Started taking piano lessons at age of 5. Attended in medical college about 3 years. From 1984 to 1985 he worked in a Tokyo hospital. After that he moved back to musical career. In 1996 he made his first solo album “The Gate Of Dreams”. 1998 second album “Into the Light”. “ONLY HEAVEN KNOWS” in 1999. 4th album “Pan-O-Rama” 2001. 2004 5th solo album ECHOES. He also made sountracks to DEAD HEAT,Emma,The Twelve Kingdoms and many more.
A Japanese anime director, storyboard artist, and animator.

Akihiro Yamada is a Japanese illustrator and manga artist. He was born in Kochi, Kochi Prefecture on the island of Shikoku in Japan, and now resides in Kyoto. Yamada is known for delicate images reminiscent of suiboku and depiction of fantasy subjects. He is the 1996 Seiun Award winner in art category.
Affiliated with [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/) since 1987. Original peers included [Masaaki Yuasa](https://anilist.co/staff/100068/) and [Tatsuo Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/100391/).
A fast and highly regarded action animator. Friends with [Tetsuya Nishio](https://anilist.co/staff/103725/) since their junior high school days.

[Takuya Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/151685/)'s brother.

_Note: Not to be confused with [Tatsuya Suzuki (鈴木辰也)](https://anilist.co/staff/225169/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/iyaiyaenn/)

She started working as animator for [Shin-Ei Douga](https://anilist.co/studio/247/ShinEi-Animation), where she later debuted as assistant episode director on [Yakyuukyou no Uta](https://anilist.co/anime/10554//) and [Ikkyuu-san](https://anilist.co/anime/4935/) before she became storyboarder and then episode director on the [Doraemon](https://anilist.co/anime/2471/Doraemon-1979/) television series. In 1982, when another former Shin-ei director, [Fukutomi Hiroshi](https://anilist.co/staff/105280/Hiroshi-Fukutomi), established [Animaru-Ya](https://anilist.co/studio/386/Animaruya) she was one of the founding members together with Sanada Yoshinobu and [Honda Toshiyuki](https://anilist.co/staff/129528/Toshiyuki--Honda). She stayed at Animaru-Ya, which is presently known as [Ekura Animaru](https://anilist.co/studio/6257/Ekura-Animal), until 2004 before leaving to work as freelancer.

(Source: aniDB)
